Trained LLMs exclusively on pre-1913 texts
1.5 TB of VRAM on Mac Studio – RDMA over Thunderbolt 5
Local WYSIWYG Markdown, mockup, data model editor powered by Claude Code
articles.content:
We have been getting the best results with Claude Code when we iterate with it to build full context and then use and update that context as we work.

So, we built Nimbalyst to be the local WYSIWYG editor and session manager where you iterate with Claude Code on markdown docs, diagrams, mockups, data-models, sessions, and code. Nimbalyst lets you:

- Work in one integrated tool leveraging all your context.

- Use all the power of Claude Code in a UI

- Work with Claude Code to write and edit WYSIWYG markdown, see AI changes as red/green, approve them

- Iterate on html mockups with Claude Code, annotating the mockups, and then use them as context for people and Claude Code coding

- Build your data models based on your docs/code, iterate on them with Claude Code, export them in standard formats.

- Integrate mermaid diagrams, text, tables, mockups, data models, and images in standard markdown for human/AI context

- Tie sessions to documents to sessions, find and resume sessions, treat sessions as context, run parallel sessions

- Code with Claude Code with all of this context, use / commands, see git status.

Nimbalyst is in Beta, local, and free. We would love your feedback.

Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=46318191

Points: 7

articles.title: Delty (YC X25) Is Hiring an ML Engineer
Delty (YC X25) Is Hiring an ML Engineer
Show HN: Spice Cayenne – SQL acceleration built on Vortex
articles.content:
Hi HN, we’re Luke and Phillip, and we’re building Spice.ai OSS - a lightweight, portable data and AI engine and powered by Apache DataFusion & Ballista for SQL query, hybrid-search, and LLM-inference across disaggregated-storage used by enterprises like Barracuda Networks and Twilio.

We first introduced Spice [1] on HN in 2021 and re-launched it on HN [2] in 2024 re-built from the ground up in Rust.

Spice includes the concept of a Data Accelerator [3], which is a way to materialize data from disparate sources, such as other databases, in embedded databases like SQLite and DuckDB.

Today we’re excited to announce a new Ducklake-inspired Data Accelerator built on Vortex [3], a highly performant, extensible columnar data format that claims 100x faster random access, 10-20x faster scans, 5x faster writes with a similar compression ratio vs. Apache Parquet.

In our tests with Spice, Vortex performs faster than DuckDB with a third of the memory usage, and is much more scalable (multi-file). For real-world deployments, we see the DuckDB Data Accelerator often capping out around 1TB, but Spice Cayenne can do Petabyte-scale.

You can read about it at https://spice.ai/blog and in the Spice OSS release notes [4].

This is just the first version, and we’d love to get your feedback!

GitHub: https://github.com/spiceai/spiceai

[1] https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=28448887

[2] https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=39854584

[3] https://github.com/vortex-data/vortex

[4] https://spiceai.org/blog/releases/v1.9.0

Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=46316991

articles.title: Monthly Updates [December]
articles.content:
INFO

These update threads only contains major updates. If you're interested in seeing all minor changes you can follow our Commits Page on GitHub or Updates Channel in Discord.

Wiki Updates

  • Added new backup site FMHY.bid. Should be unblocked more places than .net currently.

  • Added new section for Photography / Cameras.

  • Added new section for 3D Printing / Printers.

  • Re-ordered AI Benchmarks, starred Kaggle Benchmarks, removed ones with dated testing, and added a subsection for Specialized Benchmarks. Before vs After / 2.

  • Re-ordered and cleaned up ugly formatting in Hosting Tools. Before vs After / 2.

  • Moved Browser Startpages + Custom New Tab Pages out of storage into their own sections.

  • Brought back the Website for FMHY SafeGuard.

Stars Added ⭐

  • Starred AnimeX in Anime Streaming. Feature-rich, solid sources, big library, nice UI, has forums.

  • Starred Bing Image Creator in Image Gen. Gives 200 daily, has good editing, seems to be best way to use GPT Image 1 as of now.

  • Starred ⁠TizenTube Cobalt in Android TV. Ad-free YouTube app, updated often, has Sponsorblock support, uses official YouTube UI.

  • Starred Watch Footy in Live Sports. Solid sources, nice UI, lots of events.

  • Starred Streamer.bot in Live Streaming Tools. Feature-rich live stream manager, compatible w/ OBS, Streamlabs, etc.

  • Starred RoSeal in Roblox Tools. Improves Roblox website and adds nearly 200 extra features.

  • Starred Voice in Android Audiobook Players. Open-source, multi-format, has cover fetch, and nice minimal design.

  • Starred Loop Habit Tracker in Mobile Productivity. Open-source, has sticky notifications, and better limits than most free options.

  • Re-starred CDRomance in ROM Sites as its made a comeback. Note that RetroGamingTalk accounts will work on CDRomance.

Things Removed

  • Removed Anadius as they've decided to step down / 2. It may be re-added in the future if someone new steps up to maintain it.

  • Removed ContextSearch as it's been removed by Firefox. It seems to be causing issues, and in some cases flooding sites with requests. We're unsure if it's purposefully malicious, or mistakes by its dev, but regardless its recommended to remove it, and try other options like ContextSearch web-ext.

  • Unstarred Files in File Managers. There was a lot of hype for this originally, but people have started to come forward saying its too laggy / slow to be useful.

  • Unstarred Grok, Qwen, Mage and Flux.1 Schnell in Image Gen. These were considered good in the past, but there's much better, less dated free options at this point.
